results.title: When a man loves a woman
results.creator_credit: Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner, Touchstone Pictures and Luis Mandoki
results.brief_description: Family and marriage are put under threat when Alice’s (Meg Ryan) drinking becomes an addiction. Husband Michael (Andy Garcia), an airline pilot, is a perfectionist and finds it increasingly difficult to control his often reckless and neglectful wife. It takes an accident before Alice realises she has hit rock bottom and needs help. After attending a rehab clinic Alice finally returns home stronger, more independent and alcohol free but Michael, on the other hand, has problems adjusting to the new Alice. He prefers the needy and dependent wife. As the marriage begins to break down, Michael and Alice take the long and difficult road to recovery through counselling. Cast also includes Lauren Tom, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Tina Majorino, Mae Whitman, Ellen Burstyn.

results.title: When a job becomes a passion
results.creator_credit: John Balsillie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Major John Balsillie was first posted to Malaya during World War II, he became interested in World War II research and military history. It soon developed into a passion and he shipped off over 20 crates of war relics to the Australian War Memorial in Canberra. He talks of his subsequent visits during the 1960s and the second time he served, in Vietnam. This interest became a lifelong passion for John, for which he was recently awarded an MBE for services to the Australian War Memorial. John sees his role as providing a record of the brave soldiers who gave their lives for Australia.

results.title: When a fire comes to you
results.brief_description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.

results.title: Wheels wheels wheels
results.brief_description: This non-narrated film begins with a small boy launched on a downhill ride curled inside a rubber tyre. The film then proceeds to show various types of wheels: from fly-wheels to paddle-wheels, watchworks to windmills and machine gears to merry-go-rounds.

results.title: Wheels across the Himalaya
results.brief_description: In March 1981, Elisabeth Hastings, suffering from polio, and Rheinhardt Raftl, a victim of multiple sclerosis, became the first disabled people to trek across Nepal. The film shows them riding mountain ponies, through the Himalayas, travelling in rafts down one of the most violent rivers in the world, and clinging to the backs of elephants in the Chitwan jungle.

results.title: Wheel on the chimney
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The charm of the European countryside is portrayed by sweeping pictures and rhythmic words in this tale of two storks who raise their young in Hungary and then fly south to spend the winter. From the book of the same title by Margaret Wise Brown and Tibor Gergely and narrated by John Cunningham.

results.title: Wheel of prosperity
results.creator_credit: P.R.S. Pillay, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Spinning and weaving was part of the ancient heritage in India and many villagers earned their living by making textiles. When machine-made materials were imported these villages were thrown out of work and many starved. Ghandi recognised that the revival of cottage industries was essential for prosperity and through his influence the home woven textiles again became popular. The growing of cotton, spinning, carding and weaving and the marking of very simple machines to carry out these processes are shown in the film. The spinning wheel has been adopted as the symbol of prosperity for India.

results.title: Wheel is turning in Nepal
results.brief_description: Traditional culture and beginnings of technological change in Nepal. Shows the lifestyle and threatened crafts of Nepal including an introduction to Nepalese/Tibetan/Indian cooking, flour milling, and rice winnowing, wood turning, and pottery, the use of natural resources such as water to power the wood turning lathes and indicates the effects of tourism and increased trade on the native craftsmen.
